intro: Guaduella dichroa, commonly known as the two-colored guaduella, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its distinctive two-colored flowers, typically featuring a combination of white and purple or pink hues. Its leaves are usually ovate and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its unique appearance. Guaduella dichroa is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
